abstract.para: The objective of this module is to understand the structure of the platform OpenACS/.LRN, the program it uses, how do they communicate with each other, where is the data store and how the server processes the requests to produce a web page.

section.title: Scenario
section.para: The group works for the tech department of MediaCom Inc. The company needs a web platform to solve its intranet needs. The main functionality required is:

listitem.para: Typical operations in a highly interactive web platform: user management, profiles, news, discussion forums, etc.
Be able to manage a large number of users.
Extensible with ad-hoc modules written by their own programmers.
Containing applications oriented toward virtual communities where users may belong to multiple of them.
Capable to host all the material related to employee training.

section.para: After studying the solutions available in the market, the company decides to use the platform OpenACS and its extension for e-learning named .LRN.

This evaluation amounts to installing an instance of the platform (we recommend each team member to have one) study the available functionality and install an additional package created from scratch to see how feasible is to integrate a new functionality.

section.title: Strategy
section.para: To achieve this evaluation, the following steps are suggested:

listitem.para: Install an instance of OpenACS/.LRN for your personal use such that you may stop/start the server quickly at will.
Get familiar with its functionality first from the point of view of the regular user, no additional privileges, and then from the point of view of the administrator.
VMWare virtual machine with .LRN already installed. It requires downloading the VMWare Player.

Show the execution of a new package with at least a modification requiring the visualization of some data dynamically obtained from the relational data base.

Upload in the Assignment area of the course two HTML documents. One of them must contain the answer to the personal questions (one per team member) and the second must contain the answer to the group questions (thus one single document per group).

section.title: Questions
section.para: The following questions are grouped in two categories. Those that need to be answered individually, and those to be answered with a consensus within the team. All answers need to be written in an HTML document and uploaded to the Assignment area of the course.
The questions requiring an individual answer are:

listitem.para: Describe the minimum set of tools and programs that are required to install and execute correctly an instance of OpenACS/.LRN
Describe the steps that are required to create a user account in the platform.
Using a PostGreSQL client program (psql), connect to the database and obtain the number of tables used by OpenACS/.LRN. Explain the steps you followed.

section.para: The questions to be answered by the team are:

listitem.para: Explain what is the notification service offered by OpenACS/.LRN, how can it be customized? What is it used for? Advantages and disadvantages.
Is is possible to change the distribution of portlets in the initial user page? How about the number of portlets? Can the number of tabs be modified in such page?
Propose a portlet that you think it is missing and can be useful for a user in this platform.

orderedlist.listitem: Complete the implementation of the demo with a page that uses a form and invokes the function ad_form. The form should receive data from the user and insert/delete/modify it in the data base. This deliverable needs to be shown in the last session of the module.
